1. This sign means:
2. This sign warns drivers of:
column6: a low place in the road.

column2: 3. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
4. If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
column4: be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
column6: maintain your current speed while changing lanes.
column8: make a U-turn because the lane ends ahead.

column2: 5. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.

column2: 6. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column6: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.

column2: 7. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column6: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 8. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column8: enter one of the blind spots and wait.

column2: 9. Driving at night is more dangerous because:
column6: you cannot see as far ahead at night.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
11. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column6: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column8: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.

column2: 12. You are driving in the far right lane of a four lane freeway and notice broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving:
column4: in a special lane for slow moving vehicles.

column2: 13. If you approach a flashing red traffic light, you should treat the intersection the same as:
14. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as a green light.
column6: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.

16. This sign indicates:

18. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
19. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 20. Large trucks:
column4: take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.
column6: have high-tech air brakes which allow them to stop quickly.
column8: are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.

column2: 21. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column6: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column8: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.

column2: 22. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are not allowed to park here.
column6: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column8: you must display a special permit in order to park here.

column2: 23. This sign indicates:
24. To avoid traction loss from hydroplaning, drivers should:
column4: apply the brakes as soon as the car starts to skid.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the right
column8: There is a series of sharp turns up ahead on the road
